Posts.Content: They have a duty to adapt the workplace for you if you are sick. Can you threaten to work from home instead? Or maybe just 2-3 days a week from home? But I do know that, as an employer, they have to accommodate you; look up the Equality Act 2010 and how it defines a disability. Hope that helps x
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Gosh this could be me!!! After a lifetime of supporting everyone else, when it came to my turn forget it. I have no support from family or friends whatsoever, and medically I feel I am on a conveyor belt ready to be spat out at the other end. If I ask any questions I get the feeling they think I am being awkward - it's as if it is their tumour and they know what is good for it and I am just the vessel within which the tumour resided. It's horrible and a far cry from "person centred care". AND I can even relate to the deaths, lost my dad August 2014 from sepsis and my mum at the end of January this year having looked after her through a particularly nasty cancer journey.
